page.title: 05RELIGION
page.content: {COLINSBURGH CHURCH}is a Presbyterian Church of Scotland and lies in the parish of Kilconquhar. The present building was built in 1840.The village clock is set in the steeple. It is now part of a linked charge,sharing its minister with Kilconquhar and Elie Churches. This means that services are not held every Sunday in Colinsburgh, although the Sunday School is weekly. The minister is also the school chaplain. The small number of Roman Catholics attend the Church of Christ the King in Pittenweem, five miles away. Jehovah's Witnesses,Mormons and some close Brethern sects often call round the doors trying to encourage their persuasions.
